page.title: 07GLANFORD HOSPITAL, BRIGG
page.content:
Glanford Hospital is a small country hospital in Brigg. It has a small casualty for minor injuries, a small out-patient clinic and four wards with fifty-one patients in them. Some patients are in for a short stay and others are kept in for a long time as they are unable to look after themselves. The patients are all over the age of sixty-five.
It has got a small kitchen which serves the patients meals three times a day. It has also got a small physiotherapy and occupational therapy unit which helps the patients and aids their recovery. Sometimes the long term patients are taken out for rides to Cleethorpes and surrounding villages and they enjoy this very much indeed.
